meanings.definition: To make something into a commercial product or service.
meanings.sent1: The company was commercializing their new invention to sell it in stores.
meanings.sent2: She was commercializing her artwork by creating prints to sell online.
meanings.sent3: The idea of commercializing a time machine for profit seemed both exciting and risky.
meanings.sent4: He was like a wizard, commercializing dreams and turning them into tangible products.
meanings.sent5: The process of commercializing a simple recipe can turn it into a global sensation.

meanings.definition: To promote or sell something for profit.
meanings.sent1: The marketing team was commercializing the new product through various channels.
meanings.sent2: They were commercializing their services to attract more customers to their business.
meanings.sent3: The idea of commercializing a quirky invention like a flying umbrella was met with skepticism.
meanings.sent4: She had a way of commercializing even the most mundane items, making them desirable.
meanings.sent5: Commercializing a unique idea requires creativity and strategic planning.
